title: Power of Two
description:
Power of Two

Given an integer n, return true if it is a power of two. Otherwise, return false.

An integer n is a power of two, if there exists an integer x such that n == 2x.

Examples:

  • Input: n = 1
    Output: true
    Explanation: 20 = 1
  • Input: n = 16
    Output: true
    Explanation: 24 = 16
  • Input: n = 3
    Output: false

Constraints:

  • -231 <= n <= 231 - 1
solution_text:
Power of Two

Algorithm:

  1. Base case: if n <= 0, return False
  2. Base case: if n == 1, return True (20 = 1)
  3. If n is odd, return False (not divisible by 2)
  4. Recursively check n // 2

Time Complexity: O(log n) - halving each time

Space Complexity: O(log n) - recursion stack depth

Key Insights:

  • A power of two repeatedly divides evenly by 2 until reaching 1
  • Alternatively, bit trick: n > 0 and (n & (n - 1)) == 0
  • Powers of two in binary have exactly one 1-bit
